sense.name: Furnish with a grate.
sense.examples: The workers grated many holes along with avenue. I grated my fireplace yesterday.

sense.name: GRATE ON: gnaw into emotionally; make resentful or angry.
sense.examples: His attitude really grated on his coworkers. The injustice grated on her. Her voice grates on everyone.

sense.name: Shred or pulverize by rubbing against or with a sharp or rough object.
sense.examples: The cat just about grated the couch yesterday. Grate the nutmeg and set aside. The machine is designed to grate the massive blocks of cheese the factory produces.

sense.name: Rub together, possibly producing a sound or communication.
sense.commentary: Note: This sense does not include the object ground, nor imply that anything is shredded, ground, etc. It includes only the two implements of grating.
sense.examples: He grated his teeth in anger. We grated the rocks against one another. Don't run the mill empty or the stones will grate down.
